newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Surgutneftegaz ADR to start after Jan 11.
newsitem.headline: Surgutneftegaz ADR to start after Jan 11.

text.p: The American Depositary Receipt (ADR) programme of AO Surgutneftegaz will start after January 11, majority shareholder NK Surgutneftegaz (Surgut Holding) said on Monday.
One level-one ADR will cover 50 Surgutneftegaz ordinary shares, Maxim Gresko, chief executive of Surgutneftegaz's financial adviser Konvest, said on Sunday.

Bank of New York, with which Surgutneftegaz signed an agreement in November, will be the depositary bank. ING Bank Eurasia will be custodian. Surgutneftegaz received the necessary 12g3-2(b) exemption from the SEC in August last year.
The company is also planning to issue ADRs on its preferred shares.
AO Surgutneftegaz is the main operating company of Surgut Holding, Russia's third biggest oil group in terms of output and reserves.
Surgutneftegaz ordinaries closed on Sunday, a working day in Russia, at $0.501, up from $0.430 on Tuesday December 31, the previous trading day.
